Men make sacrifices everyday in their place of work, in their role as husbands and fathers, for their families, for their friends, for their communities and for their nations. As part of #IMD2017, we celebrate our international male teammates and thank them for their hard work and contribution to society.
I got the job! I am now the integration analyst for GlobalTranz. My dream job, finally coming to fruition. Truly amazing.
I couldn't have done it without the amazing support from my dear friends at Coder Camps, specifically Jason Jones. If it wasn't for Jason, there's no way I'd be anywhere close to where I am today.

I highly recommend checking them out if you are interested in learning how to code. I moved here from Texas to take the program, and couldn't be happier with the results. If you're interested in learning how to be a code ninja like me, shoot me, or Jason Jones a message.
I'd love for you to feel how I feel right now, knowing the countless hours of work, and research paid off.
Hope everyone is having as great of a Monday as I am!
Why I Left a Big, Prestigious Law Firm to Become a Product Manager at a Startup
I HIRED a person over 50. Should not be a big deal, but it was. You can't imagine the resistance I had to overcome.
" He will never work hard enough", "he will not fit into our culture", "he will be taking a lot of sick days", "he is overqualified" etc
Nobody said he was too old. They were all "politically correct".
Even now, many years later, I am still upset about those remarks.
I had to put my foot down to get him hired.
Long story short, he was one of the best hires I ever made. We all learned from him. He made a huge difference for the company.
We should STOP calling people over 50 as "overqualified" and "over the hill".
Instead let's consider using these: veteran, very experienced, "someone I can learn from", someone who can make a huge difference because of their experience.

This online course is designed to teach existing ASP.NET Web Forms developers how to expand their skills into the ASP.NET MVC model environment. All key aspects of the ASP.NET MVC environment are covered. The course begins by covering the underlying architecture and runtime environment, as well as the MVC pattern of an ASP.NET MVC application. The material then builds to include all key aspects, such as Controllers (in-depth), Views (in-depth), Models (in-depth), Routing, Error Handling, Data Entry and Data Validation, AJAX, Testability and Unit Testing, and Customizing ASP.NET MVC environment.

Sr Software Engineer at L4 Digital

After working with Debbie at CoderCamps for 12 weeks, I found that she is not only quick at learning technologies (FullStack ASP.NET + JavaScript), but also has a very good understanding of the mechanics of the technologies she learned. Debbie also showed great leadership skills in a team environment while working on a group project called “Athena”.  She not only led the team to success, but also volunteered to help others who needed help with their project development.  At the same time, she maintained an open communication with me and other instructors to make sure we were aware of the progress of their group project. While she excelled in all aspects of ASP.NET + JavaScript , but I was particularly impressed with her utilization of repository pattern on her server-side and client-side angular code.Overall, Debbie proved herself to be a skillful FullStack ASP.NET + JavaScript developer and I am confident in her ability to do well and excel in her career as a web developer.

“Knowledge magnet” is the phrase that comes to mind when I think of Debbie Westwood. She is a service-oriented leader, willing to take on any new challenge, and a relentless pursuer of knowledge.  I’ve had the pleasure of knowing Debbie for over three years now, first when she worked for me as a Solutions Consultant and later when I promoted her to Training Manager at Ipro Tech.  Debbie can immerse herself into any new technical subject and quickly ramp up to serve as a proficient subject matter expert.  She has a real knack for translating complex ideas and/or concepts into simple language that anyone can understand.  And, of course I will always remember Debbie’s “work hard, play hard” approach to life…there is no getting her off the dance floor once the music starts playing.  Debbie is truly one of toughest, hardest working, dedicated, and caring people I have ever had the pleasure of working with.  She would be a true asset for any position she is considered for and comes with my heartfelt recommendation.

March 2, 2016, Matt and Debbie were students together

Debbie was an absolute pleasure to work with. I was a fellow student with Debbie during her time in the Coder Camps Full-Stack .NET course. Debbie proved herself to be such an invaluable classmate to bounce ideas off of and ask advice to when I needed assistance. She quickly grasped all of the different technologies being taught, which included AngularJS, Typescript/Javascript, C#, Entity Framework, CSS3, HTML5, and Bootstrap to name a few. Many other students were also able to benefit from Debbie's in-depth knowledge of our course material, as I know she spent many hours helping as much as she could, in addition to her course work. In short, Debbie proved herself to be much more than just a student, but also a mentor to myself and other classmates, and I am extremely confident in her ability to do well in her future career as a web developer.

I’ve known and worked with Debbie Westwood since 2008. Debbie is not only a consummate professional, but she is probably the best presenter of difficult software applications ever. She has a wonderful, cheerful, and engaging style; and she really knows her stuff! I’ve had the pleasure of her support in both face to face client meetings and countless web based software presentations. She is cool, calm, organized, and most importantly quickly relates to her audience with lively and on-point examples of real world experiences. As a trainer, you can’t ask for better. Debbie consistently gets rave feedback on her direct training sessions and since December of 2014 has skillfully led Ipro’s training department as well. Any organization would be blessed to have Debbie. I wholeheartedly recommend her.

I considered myself fortunate when she agreed to join the Firm fulltime in the operational management role.Debbie is a dedicated and customer service oriented manager who effectively and consistently delivered high quality and on time service. She is well respected and liked by her staff, peers, and management. Debbie is an asset to her team and organization.

I was a newly-minted graduate of a coding bootcamp, the capstone to several years of study aimed at getting me into programming.  Job-hunting when you're changing career from a field you've spent several years in is not easy - and even more so when you don't necessarily fit the image of a typically software engineer.Enter Sean Mazanec.  He represented G/O Digital well, answered my many questions, made sure he was the friendly face welcoming me when I showed up for my interviews, managed to get me comfortable and relaxed before going into the interview, and stayed on top of the myriad details that make up the hiring process.I was thrilled when I was hired, and I owe Sean thanks for making my overall experience as smooth as possible, not to mention taking a chance on someone who hardly fits the "traditional" cliché of a programmer.

Coleman and myself worked together on our final group project.  He designed the database, which included several many to many relationships and wrote some of the more complex LINQ statements in the WebAPI service to retrieve data based on user input in the UI.I relied on Coleman as my primary sounding board when working through issues in the code and I could guarantee that he'd suggest good, solid solutions. Coleman was always quick to grasp concepts and I appreciated his exceptional understanding of how to design efficient algorithms for solving problems.Coleman is smart, quick to learn, and will make an excellent programmer.

summary: I am a full-stack .NET web developer dedicated to improving workflows and the understanding of data through the use of technology.  I specialize in C#, Web API, React, Angular, Javascript, ES6, TypeScript, Boostrap, Azure Table Services.  I will learn any technology that gets the job done, and sometimes "just because".  Right now I'm working towards certificates in Python and Data Science.You can reach me by messaging me through LinkedIn, or at dtwestwood@intechgration.com.From understanding what's in your documents, to who was communicating with whom at critical decision points in your business, to understanding how a poor night's sleep invariably leads to downing a pint of ice-cream, I have always been fascinated by retrieving and presenting data to "tell the story" so you can make better decisions for your business and your life.As a web developer, I want to understand what doesn't work with your workflow and use software to help smooth out those kinks.  I want to understand how data - whether for business or personal life - informs your decisions both big and small.  And I want to help you access what you need, when you need it, wherever you need it: on the road, at home or work, waiting in line at the grocery store.My own journey to this point has given me a deep understanding of how all of our decisions are affected by data; so getting the right data at the right time, and in the right format, is critical.  I have seen how the tyranny of "we've always done it this way" causes inefficiencies and missed opportunities.  I understand the importance of making software intuitive because the best app in the world means nothing if no-one uses it.What do you need from me today?
name: Debbie Westwood
title: Software Engineer at Coder Camps
